required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: A Prospective study on the performance and safety of the HeartStart OnSite (Model M5066A) & HeartStart Home (Model M5068A) Defibrillator device data.

detailed_description.textblock: The objective of this PMCF (Post Market Clinical Follow-up) prospective collection of post-event data registry is to confirm the safety and performance as expressed in the energy delivery by the HeartStart HS1 Defibrillator (HeartStart OnSite and Home models in North America) in the population for the device's intended use in reference to its commercial labeling, and in relationship to the type of pads attached to the device.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean shock energy delivered in the pediatric population
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 15 minutes during device placement
primary_outcome.description: Mean of shock energy delivered, when the pediatric defibrillation pads were attached to the AED as intended for infants and children under 25 kilograms / 55 pounds or 0-8 years old.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean shock energy delivered in the adult population
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 15 minutes during device placement
primary_outcome.description: Mean of shock energy delivered, when the adult defibrillation pads were attached to the AED as intended for in children and adults over 25 kilograms / 55 pounds or greater than 8 years old.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency and severity of unexpected adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 15 minutes during device placement
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency and severity of unexpected adverse events

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 15 minutes during device placement
Up to 15 minutes during device placement

secondary_outcome.measure: Routine self-test performance/Battery Insertion self-test performance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 15 minutes during device placement
secondary_outcome.description: Routine self-test performance/Battery Insertion self-test performance

arm_group.description: All subjects with suspected of a circulatory arrest of any cause.

study_pop.textblock: Anyone who is suspected of having a sudden cardiac arrest.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have been suspected of a circulatory arrest for any cause.
- Have had HeartStart HS1 Defibrillator with electrodes:
Adult SMART Pads Cartridge [REF: M5071A], Infant/Child SMART Pads Cartridge (REF:M5072A) applied to their body and powered up with HS1 battery (Model M5070A), regardless of whether a defibrillation shock was delivered
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects will be excluded if any of the following are present:
- AED or pad use other than the HeartStart HS1 Defibrillator with above referenced Philips electrode pads. Note: Use of a device other than the Philips HeartStart HS1 AED does not preclude enrollment if the AED or an Advanced Life Support defibrillator was used after the HeartStart HS1 AED.
- AED used for training purposes.
